item.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the likes of Nvidia, Sony, and AMD and previews from Sunday’s Unveiled event.

item.title: Data security startup Cyera hits $9B valuation six months after being valued at $6B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Cyera raised another $400 million just six months after its last huge round.

item.title: Governments grapple with the flood of non-consensual nudity on X
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: For the past two weeks, X has been flooded with AI-manipulated nude images, created by the Grok AI chatbot — and governments around the world are promising to take action.

item.title: GTMfund has rewritten the distribution playbook for the AI era
item.dc:creator: Maggie Nye, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Building software products has never been easier, so why are so many well-funded startups failing to take off no matter how good their product is? In this season finale episode of Build Mode, our guest has an answer: Startups have focused too much on product development and not enough on distribution excellence. Paul Irving is partner and […]

item.title: Critics pan spyware maker NSO’s transparency claims amid its push to enter US market
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The infamous spyware maker released a new transparency report claiming to be a responsible spyware maker, without providing insight into how the company dealt with problematic customers in the past.

item.title: EverNitro is simplifying the process of crafting silky nitro coffee at CES 2026
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: EverNitro is positioning itself against competitors such as NitroBrew as a long-term more affordable all-in-one solution. “We offer the quality of a commercial tap with the footprint of a coffee maker. While others sell you gas, we give you technology to harvest it for free,” founder and CEO Terry Tan said.

item.title: I watched LG’s new home robot CLOid do laundry but I have questions
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: CES is always chock-full of robots, and this year electronics giant LG announced a new bot, dubbed CLOid, that it claims will revolutionize household chores (as in, you won't have to do them anymore).

item.title: Internet collapses in Iran amid protests over economic crisis
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Internet monitoring firms and experts say Iran’s internet has almost completely shut down, as protests spread through major cities.

item.title: OpenAI to acquire the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI is acquiring the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo in an all-stock deal, adding to the firm's M&A spree.

item.title: Anduril’s Palmer Luckey thinks the future of tech is in the past
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Luckey, who initially made his fortune in VR and now runs the defense contractor Anduril, and Ohanian both seemed to agree: Stuff was better in the old days.

item.title: Disney+ is launching short-form videos this year
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move comes as Disney launched a personalized vertical video feed in the ESPN app last year.

item.title: The most bizarre tech announced so far at CES 2026
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From an AI panda pet to an anime girl hologram for your desk, here are the wildest products at CES 2026.

item.title: Illinois health department exposed over 700,000 residents’ personal data for years
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The security lapse exposed personal information belonging to residents who received state benefits.

item.title: Nvidia’s reportedly asking Chinese customers to pay upfront for its H200 AI chips
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Nvidia is now requiring its customers in China to pay upfront in full for its H200 AI chips even as approval stateside and from Beijing remains uncertain.

item.title: Snowflake announces its intent to buy observability platform Observe
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Snowflake is bolstering its data stack to make the platform better suited to the sheer volume of data produced by AI agents.

item.title: Go-to-market strategies for an AI era
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: In the season finale of Build Mode, Isabelle Johannessen sits down with Paul Irving, partner and COO of GTMfund, to discuss go-to-market strategies for the AI era. Paul shares specific, actionable advice on how early-stage startups can win even when facing well-funded competitors who iterate at lightning speed. He also explains why distribution has become the final remaining moat when technical advantages disappear in months […]

item.title: Elon Musk’s lawsuit against OpenAI will face a jury in March
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers said there was evidence suggesting OpenAI’s leaders made assurances that its original nonprofit structure would be maintained. The case will go to trial in March.

item.title: Why this VC thinks 2026 will be ‘the year of the consumer’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: AI adoption in enterprise is stalling as companies don't know where to start. Vanessa Larco of Premise VC thinks 2026 will be the year of the consumer.

item.title: Hands-on with a prototype of Clicks’ Communicator, a new BlackBerry-like smartphone
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: TechCrunch goes hands-on at the CES 2026 show with the new Clicks Communicator, a new Android smartphone with a physical keyboard.

item.title: Gmail debuts a personalized AI Inbox, AI Overviews in search, and more
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Gmail is also bringing several AI features that were previously available only to paid users to all users.
